column4: I want to switch my PCI card out with an AGP card. What are the steps in warty+backports?
Can anyone point me to a howto on changing a video card in Ubuntu?
pozac it's a pci card now, i have a 16 meg agp card to install
Is there a basic howto on changing a video card out on an ubuntu box?
pozac can I run a video config program for X from a terminal or GNOME and tell it Vesa? then switch the card out?
pozac I don't know what kind of card i'm installing. Is there an autodetect?
dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg is about your best option  (replace xorg with xfree86 if warty)
I run that with X shut down?
what I just said will ask you whether you want it to try autodetect
doesn't really matter... just need to restart to take effect...
if you don't know, you're not ready to  :)
I've followed the information in the ubuntu wiki. It talks about changing from sarge to hoary.
pozac this isn't a critical system. I was annoyed that I had to install extra stuff (backports) just to get firefox to 1.0.x
if that states 5.04, you are running hoary..
cuz you just stated a guide told you how to switch from sarge to hoary, and you followed it...
pozac It says warty. I've only installed the backports sofar. So Firefox is at least up to 1.x

I read it. I followed it with my eyes. It was a little confusing. Just cause you'all say I shouldn't switch to hoary yet... I've got to tell you, installing warty was no fun. For some reason, the fonts for X were never installed (default installation). So X wouldn't start. I had never troubleshooted X under warty/ubuntu/debian before.
